column4: Where can I install mysql-server to make !lamp (https://help.ubuntu.com/community/ApacheMySQLPHP) run?
err how can I, or where can I get it. something, http://pastebin.com/w64QsMaY apt-get sure as hell isn't working
did you install LAMP by issueing  sudo tasksel install lamp-server ?
yes and it says that it depends on mysql-server
installing lamp-server through tasksel will install all required components. Have you any idea what *is* installed and what is not?
I've tried, it says $ sudo tasksel install lamp-server
have you edited your sources.list recently?
yes to remove a screw up, and afterwords I updated
did you run 'sudo apt-get update' ?
ok. Just checking.
the thing is, the aptitude (100) error often disappears when an extra sudo apt-get update is done
another one, have you done a   sudo dpkg --configure -a

you can try that, it'll try to 'reconfigure' any packages that are not in a configured state currently. Anyway there's tons of information on the aptitude 100 error, meaning that the package metadata is not updated.
sudo dpkg --configure -a   doesn't do anything
if it just returns the command prompt, it has run. you're fine. You are sure your source.list don't contain any non-standard repositories?
you dualboot with mint?
no I fresh installed ubuntu last night, I thought that I had graduated and put on my big boy pants..
haha, ok. So the sources.list is completely fresh also
ok. Are you sure there is no other instance of a packagemanager running?
how can I check? just to restart?

well you could do a restart of course, but with the command 'ps' you can search for running processes. For example  ps axuww | grep -i synap   will search for processes such as Synaptic packagemanager
I just reformatted and everything installed just fine. so I had screwed something up
aha! Good to hear it's fixed. Nice that you came back to tell :)
